The image shows a tropical cyclone advisory bulletin from the National Hurricane Center. The disturbance is moving northwestward through the central Gulf of Mexico and is expected to reach the Louisiana coast late Wednesday or Wednesday night. Maximum sustained winds are near 40 mph (65 km/h), with higher gusts, and some slight strengthening is possible before it reaches the coast. The estimated minimum central pressure is 1000 mb (29.53 inches). Tropical storm conditions are expected to first reach the coast within the warning area by this afternoon, and rainfall amounts of 4 to 8 inches with isolated maximum amounts of 10 inches over southeastern Louisiana, southern Mississippi, and the Florida Panhandle through Thursday morning. The next intermediate advisory is at 700 AM CDT, and the next complete advisory is at 1000 AM CDT.
